messages.message:
I have gone through the python modules as listed in `tools/devtools/code-dependencies/python/requirements.txt`, looking for modules that aren’t actually used in our codebase, or are otherwise possibly in need of attention. If you see a module listed that you want to keep around, just let me know.
```
Flask-Login
bcrypt
dateparser
gitpython # Docs warn against using in daemons/long running processes - https://github.com/gitpython-developers/GitPython#leakage-of-system-resources
h5py # Only under experimental, last touched Dec 2018 - Ted
kombu
mkdocs # Stand-alone tool that doesn't appear to be used, could be wrong?
pyOpenSSL # Only used in experimental, hasn't been touched in over a year - Jesika
pyasn1-modules
ray # Only used in experimental, hasn't been touched since Dec. 2017 - Jesika, Anant
tensorflow # Only used in experimental, hasn't been touched since May 2018 - Ted
```
Tagging people specifically when a module is used only in their experimental section, and hasn’t been touched in a long time. @Ted @Jesika Haria @Anant
One thing I noticed was that one of our customers used tensorflow in a notebook. So that may be more involved than it looks initially.
Though one thing I do not understand fully… is the devtools requirements only used for local development/building?
i thought tensorflow was in image-tasks

The only mention of tensorflow or tf that I can find in image-tasks is this: ```build/py/instabase/model_utils/classifier_neural1.py
113:    # TODO: TensorFlow can't run inside Celery as we run it presently because TF isn't fork-safe.```

Line 52 in the dockerfile:
`RUN pip install --user tensorflow==1.5.0-rc1 && `
Right, sorry. I meant to say “in code”.
ohhhh got it
I’m 100% positive that we’re currently installing modules in the requirements.txt and Dockerfiles that aren’t actually being used anywhere.
I’m trying to clean that up :slightly_smiling_face:
yes, please do!! :slightly_smiling_face:
I think xlsxwriter may be in use in some customer notebooks or udfs
I have no evidence of this but I think I used it like a year ago
I’ll take `xlsxwriter` off the list. :thumbsup:

We do need zbarlight, it's used for qr code reading. the folder is called old_implementation because we optimistically think there will be a new implementation, but probably should just rename it because it's the current implementation
cc @Chetan @Loc why names are important :stuck_out_tongue:
lol `old_but_still_in_use_implementation`
@lydia
aka “legacy” :stuck_out_tongue:
No worries, zbarlight is out of the list as well. :slightly_smiling_face:
Everything is legacy with respect to tomorrow?
